Content:
![Banner](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/vivienhenz24/fuzzy-canary/main/./readme-banner.png) # Fuzzy Canary AI companies are scraping everyone's sites for training data. If you're self-hosting your blog, there's not much you can do about it, except maybe make them think your site contains content they won't want. Fuzzy Canary plants invisible links (to porn websites...) in your HTML that trigger scrapers' content safeguards.
[![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@fuzzycanary/core)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@fuzzycanary/core) [![CI](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/vivienhenz24/fuzzyfrontend/ci.yml?branch=main&label=CI)](https://github.com/vivienhenz24/fuzzyfrontend/actions) [![License](https://img.shields.io/npm/l/@fuzzycanary/core)](https://github.com/vivienhenz24/fuzzyfrontend/blob/main/LICENSE) [![npm downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/@fuzzycanary/core)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@fuzzycanary/core) [![Bundle size](https://img.shields.io/bundlephobia/minzip/%40fuzzycanary%2Fcore)](https://bundlephobia.com/package/@fuzzycanary/core)
## Getting Started ### Installation

## Getting Started ### Installation

RowTranslations.originContent: AI companies are scraping everyone's sites for training data. If you're self-hosting your blog, there's not much you can do about it, except maybe make them think your site contains content they won't want. Fuzzy Canary plants invisible links (to porn websites...) in your HTML that trigger scrapers' content safeguards.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: AI companies are scraping everyone's sites for training data. If you're self-hosting your blog, there's not much you can do about it, except maybe make them think your site contains content they won't want. Fuzzy Canary plants invisible links (to porn websites...) in your HTML that trigger scrapers' content safeguards.

Content:
### Usage

There are two ways to use it: client-side or server-side. Use server-side if you can—it works better because the canary is in the HTML from the start, so scrapers that don't run JavaScript will still see it.

**Server-side (recommended):**

If you're using a React-based framework (Next.js, Remix, etc.), add the `<Canary />` component to your root layout:
Translation:
### Utilisation

Il existe deux façons de l'utiliser : côté client ou côté serveur. Utilisez côté serveur si possible — cela fonctionne mieux car la canarie est dans le HTML dès le départ, donc les scrapers qui n'exécutent pas JavaScript la verront quand même.

**Côté serveur (recommandé) :**

Si vous utilisez un framework basé sur React (Next.js, Remix, etc.), ajoutez le composant `<Canary />` à votre mise en page racine :

RowTranslations.originContent: There are two ways to use it: client-side or server-side. Use server-side if you can—it works better because the canary is in the HTML from the start, so scrapers that don't run JavaScript will still see it.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Il existe deux façons de l'utiliser : côté client ou côté serveur. Utilisez côté serveur si possible — cela fonctionne mieux car la canarie est dans le HTML dès le départ, donc les scrapers qui n'exécutent pas JavaScript la verront quand même.

RowTranslations.originContent: If you're using a React-based framework (Next.js, Remix, etc.), add the `<Canary />` component to your root layout:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Si vous utilisez un framework basé sur React (Next.js, Remix, etc.), ajoutez le composant `<Canary />` à votre mise en page racine :

RowTranslations.originContent: // Other React frameworks: your root layout file
RowTranslations.translatedContent: // Other React frameworks: your root layout file

Content:
For non-React frameworks, use the `getCanaryHtml()` utility and insert it at the start of your `<body>` tag.

**Client-side:**

If you're building a static site or prefer client-side injection, import the auto-init in your entry file:
Translation:
Pour les frameworks non-React, utilisez l’utilitaire `getCanaryHtml()` et insérez-le au début de votre balise `<body>`.

**Côté client :**

Si vous créez un site statique ou préférez l’injection côté client, importez l’auto-initialisation dans votre fichier d’entrée :

RowTranslations.originContent: For non-React frameworks, use the `getCanaryHtml()` utility and insert it at the start of your `<body>` tag.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Pour les frameworks non-React, utilisez l’utilitaire `getCanaryHtml()` et insérez-le au début de votre balise `<body>`.

RowTranslations.originContent: If you're building a static site or prefer client-side injection, import the auto-init in your entry file:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Si vous créez un site statique ou préférez l’injection côté client, importez l’auto-initialisation dans votre fichier d’entrée :

Content:
```ts
// Your main entry file (e.g., main.ts, index.ts, App.tsx)
import '@fuzzycanary/core/auto'
```
Translation:
```ts
// Your main entry file (e.g., main.ts, index.ts, App.tsx)
import '@fuzzycanary/core/auto'
```

RowTranslations.originContent: // Your main entry file (e.g., main.ts, index.ts, App.tsx)
RowTranslations.translatedContent: // Your main entry file (e.g., main.ts, index.ts, App.tsx)

Content:
That's it. It will automatically inject the canary when the page loads.

## Notes on SEO

Fuzzy Canary now injects for every visitor, including crawlers. If you're concerned about how this affects indexing or rankings, consider testing in a staging environment before rolling out to production.
Translation:
C'est tout. Le canari sera automatiquement injecté lorsque la page se charge.

## Notes sur le SEO

Fuzzy Canary s'injecte désormais pour chaque visiteur, y compris les robots d'indexation. Si vous vous inquiétez de l'impact sur l'indexation ou le classement, envisagez de tester dans un environnement de préproduction avant de déployer en production.

RowTranslations.originContent: That's it. It will automatically inject the canary when the page loads.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: C'est tout. Le canari sera automatiquement injecté lorsque la page se charge.

RowTranslations.originContent: Fuzzy Canary now injects for every visitor, including crawlers. If you're concerned about how this affects indexing or rankings, consider testing in a staging environment before rolling out to production.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Fuzzy Canary s'injecte désormais pour chaque visiteur, y compris les robots d'indexation. Si vous vous inquiétez de l'impact sur l'indexation ou le classement, envisagez de tester dans un environnement de préproduction avant de déployer en production.
